example-descriptor.title: Resizing Images With XForms and Flickr

div.p: This XForms example is based on a tutorial by Mark Birbek. It illustrates connecting to a Flickr service to query images matching certain tags, and then displaying them while allowing for resizing them with a slider.
Please note that we made the following changes compared to the tutorial version:

li.p: Updated XPath expression to use XPath 2.0 if().
Updated CSS rules, as OPS does not as of yet support the xforms\:something notation in CSS, but uses classes of the form .xforms-something instead.

div.p: We also made the following minor changes, mainly for improved usability and appearance:

li.p: Set a default value of "flower" in the "tags" input field.
Set the minimum slider value to 10 instead of 1.
Used more explicit labels, some descriptive text, and updates to layout and style.
The submission can be done also by pressing "enter" in the input field ( DOMActivate runs xforms:send ).
Added xforms:output control to display the current value of the slider, as the OPS slider does not show the numerical value by default.
Put hidden <span> in the repeat so that IE flows the images correctly.
